item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "They never opened the door which leads to the soul." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There is more simplicity in the man who eats caviar on impulse than in the man who eats Grape-Nuts on principle." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "I’m not sentimental about anything. Life flows by, and you flow with it or you don’t. Move on and move out." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Rebecca West
item.description: "Just how difficult it is to write biography can be reckoned by anybody who sits down and considers just how many people know the real truth about his or her love affairs." -- Rebecca West

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Margaret Drabble
item.description: "When nothing is sure, everything is possible." -- Margaret Drabble

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "I am quite a wise old bird, but I am no desert hermit who can only prophesy when his guts are knotted with hunger. I am deep in the old man’s puzzle, trying to link the wisdom of the body with the wisdom of the spirit until the two are one." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "You are so afraid of losing your moral sense that you are not willing to take it through anything more dangerous than a mud-puddle. " -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Patrick White
item.description: "Because he had nothing to hide, he did perhaps appear to have forfeited a little of his strength. But that is the irony of honesty." -- Patrick White

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description:
"[Henry] James's critical genius comes out most tellingly in his mastery over, his baffling escape from, Ideas; a mastery and an escape which are perhaps the last test of a superior intelligence. <i>He had a mind so fine that no idea could violate it.</i> [...] In England, ideas run wild and pasture on the emotions; instead of thinking with our feelings (a very different thing) we corrupt our feelings with ideas; we produce the public, the political, the emotional idea, evading sensation and thought. [...] James in his novels is like the best French critics in maintaining a point of view, a view-point untouched by the parasite idea. He is the most intelligent man of his generation."
(<i>Little Review</i>, 1918)" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "There are so many ways of being despicable it quite makes one’s head spin. But the way to be really despicable is to be contemptuous of other people’s pain." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Laurie Anderson
item.description: "When you meet a man who is broken, pick him up and carry him. When you meet a woman who’s broken, put her all into your arms. Cause we don’t know where we come from … we don’t know where we are. " -- Laurie Anderson

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Pursue some path, however narrow and crooked, in which you can walk with love and reverence." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Peter Morgan
item.description: "Ambition interests me because it’s such a surefire indicator of damage." -- Peter Morgan

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "Tell me whom you haunt and I’ll tell you who you are." -- Andre Breton

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Horace Greeley
item.description: "I am too sick to be out of bed, too crazy to sleep, and am surrounded by horrors." -- Horace Greeley

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by R. Buckminster Fuller
item.description: "When I am working on a problem, I never think about beauty........ but when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong." -- R. Buckminster Fuller

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Take care of the luxuries and the necessities will take care of themselves." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "A real building is one on which the eye can light and stay lit." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Plato
item.description: "We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light." -- Plato

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Meister Eckhart
item.description: "Nothing in all creation is so like God as stillness." -- Meister Eckhart

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "Only the very greatest art invigorates without consoling." -- Iris Murdoch

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "To complain that I could only be married once was like complaining that I had only been born once." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Peter Ustinov
item.description: "Love is an act of endless forgiveness; a tender look which becomes a habit." -- Peter Ustinov

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Simone Weil
item.description: "All sins are attempts to fill voids." -- Simone Weil

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Alfred Adler
item.description: "The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions." -- Alfred Adler

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Vaclav Havel
item.description: "Hope is not a feeling of certainty that everything ends well. Hope is just a feeling that life and work have a meaning." -- Vaclav Havel

item.title: Jeannette add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them." -- Kahlil Gibran
